scenarioDescription:
The 2MASS J04414489+2301513 Exoplanetary System


Overview

2MASS J04414489+2301513 is a star with 0.02 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.001 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

2MASS J04414489+2301513 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the 2MASS J04414489+2301513 system


2MASS J04414489+2301513 b

2MASS J04414489+2301513 b was discovered by the Hubble Space Telescope observatory, in 2010-05, using the imaging method. Its semi-major axis is 15.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 2MASS J04414489+2301513 b is 2385.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of 2MASS J04414489+2301513 b is 12.600 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 2MASS J04414489+2301513 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system 2MASS J04414489+2301513, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Hubble Space Telescope.
name: 2MASS J04414489+2301513 - System With 1 Exoplanet
